# The `Operator` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is a utility class that provides an abstraction for the common functionality between Instructions and ConstantExprs. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::Operator</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This is a utility class that provides an abstraction for the common functionality between Instructions and ConstantExprs.

Definition at line 32 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h">Operator.h</a>.

### hasPoisonGeneratingAnnotations() {#a6a00db34fcfed5b0ce3aa7a33ac6e7fb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::Operator::hasPoisonGeneratingAnnotations () const">
Return true if this operator has poison-generating flags, return attributes or metadata.

The latter two is only possible for instructions.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h/#l00071">71</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/operator-h">Operator.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/operator-cpp/#l00062">62</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/operator-cpp">Operator.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

Return true if this operator has flags which may cause this operator to evaluate to poison despite having non-poison inputs.
